intro: Chrysocoma subumbellata, commonly known as the small-umbellate chrysocoma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish to greenish flowers arranged in clusters, giving it a delicate appearance. Its leaves are typically narrow and slightly hairy, adapting to arid environments. Chrysocoma subumbellata is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in semi-arid regions.
